articles.title: Taking solar eclipse photos can damage your smartphone camera, NASA claims - India Today
articles.description: NASA warns against directly pointing smartphone cameras at the solar eclipse claiming it can cause sensor damage The eclipse visible only in parts of North America and Europe is set to occur on April 8
articles.content: The solar eclipse or surya grahan is all set to take place on April 8. Although it would be visible in some countries, the NASA scientists have a special message for people who like to capture eclips… [+2138 chars]

articles.title: Total solar eclipse forecast: Will your city have clear skies Monday? - The Associated Press
articles.description: Clouds could obscure views of Monday's total solar eclipse in some parts of North America. There is still plenty of time for forecasts to change, but meteorologists predict that a storm front could bring clouds to many locations along the eclipse's path, incl…
articles.content:
DALLAS (AP) Some who hope to witness Mondays total solar eclipse may see the sun obscured by clouds instead of by the moon.

articles.title: NASA wants you to help gather Sun data during total solar eclipse - Fox Weather
articles.description: If you have always wanted to be a NASA scientist, here is your chance. NASA is involved in several scientific research projects that need your help if you are along the path of totality during the America's Total Eclipse on April 8th.

articles.author: Jacqueline Howard
articles.title: As the world ages, cancer cases are projected to rise, hitting some countries like ‘a tidal wave’ - CNN
articles.description: Around the world each year, tens of millions of people are told they have cancer, and millions die from the disease. Now, a report from the American Cancer Society projects that by 2050, the number of people with cancer could rise 77%.
